intro: Rubus schmidelyanus var. pullus, commonly known as the Schmidel’s blackberry variant, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It produces small, dark purple to black berries that are typically harvested in late summer. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and thorny stems, typical of the Rubus genus. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial shade, often found in forested areas. Its berries are valued for their tart flavor and are used in local culinary traditions.
